Reviews.Title: “Dirty glasses”
Reviews.Author: BExplorer
Reviews.Content: I`ve been at Maria Barbara during 5 business days, and during all these days I`ve never able to use a single glass at the restaurant on breakfasts. I could fell them dirty by touching them.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient if you need to be around Satelite”
Reviews.Author: ICI01
Reviews.Content: If you have your appointments in or around Satelite, the Maria Barbara is a very good option, nice and comfortable, with a very good breakfast. It is right alongside the periferico but you do not have much problems with the noise. Nearby is a shoppingmall where you can find cinema's, shops and several restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a reasonable price in the north of the city”
Reviews.Author: hernan83
Reviews.Content: The María Barbara Hotel located at the Periférico ring in Satélite north of Mexico City is a really good deal and the most recommendable option for business trips when you have some business in this area. The personnel is very nice and willing to help. If you prefer they also give you a tour and show you arround in the hotel. The offer is very complete, you have a well equipped gym, a pool and garden area, which is really appreciated in this crowded city, a restaurant and very nice and calm rooms despite the fact that it is located at the Periférico. The only thing is that the hotel bar is under construction and according to the personnel it still takes until 2012. Rooms are very clean, calm and cosy. In comparison to other hotels in the city, the windows can be opened. The bathroom is also nice and the closet contains a small safe, which is a common feature also in Mexico. Prices vary and depend on the time of stay, if it is during the week or at the weekend. Companies can also get a corporate rate, which really pays off!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Atmosphere, Nice People”
Reviews.Author: itsaboutthepeople
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for the purpose of my trip (business) and I didn't spend an overwhelming amount of time there. If I had been there for vacation, the location probably wouldn't have been the best. The room was nice. Spacious, clean, and had everything I could possibly need. It was quiet and I slept well. I wrestled a little with the temperature control, but I suspect that was more a problem with me than the system. The people were extremely nice and very efficient. Breakfast was varied and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice public area but...”
Reviews.Author: thingtodo
Reviews.Content: Very nice public area but the rooms in the towers were dispointing. Two separate visits with the same result: floors were not vacumed and not face cloth in room. The room had a musky odor which Febreze (fabric refreshener and odor remover) did not touch. They did respond to the vacume and face cloth request but did not address the smell. You also had to pay for internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Delivered as Promised”
Reviews.Author: threeputt
Reviews.Content: I brought my American family to Mexico City to meet my wife's family. We booked 7 rooms at this location primarily for its convenient location and because it appeared to be a good value. They had a bit of construction going on (I hear they are becoming a Sheraton) but dust & noise were not an issue. The kids made full use of the pool and the workout center was excellent. The morning buffet had both Mexican & American favorites which allowed my relatives to sample new items at their own pace. Overall I can't think of anything this hotel could have done better. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a bit of sanctuary in the big city.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Maria Barbara
HotelInfo.Address: Blvd A Camacho 2300, Mexico City 54050, Mexico
